author: Special Correspondent
text:
Parents and relatives staged a protest here blocking East Coast Road (ECR) demanding action against the correspondent and staff of a private school who they held responsible for drowning of two students when they went to attend special classes.

According to police, special classes were conducted for ninth standard students at the private school- Swaminatha Vidyalaya School. After the class the students went to bathe in the sea near Anichamkuppam.

But they were dragged into the sea by strong waves. Hearing the screams of the classmates, fishermen attempted to rescue them but the efforts went in vain.

The victims were identified as R. Vignesh Raja(14) and Guna Sanjay(14). Kottakuppam police with assistance of the local fishermen could only recover the body of Vignesh Raja from the waters.

However, the parents picketed the road. They wanted a case to be registered against the correspondent V. Saminathan, BJP Puducherry unit president and management staff.

Following a complaint from one of the parents, the police questioned him in connection with the incident and registered the complaint against the management of the school for offences under Sections- 304 (A) Causing death by negligence) of Indian Penal Code.

Another drowning death was reported in the beach near Auroville where Ramgopal, first year engineering student who went long with his friends to take bath.
title: Drowning incident: parents hold school responsible
